p: Spondweni virus (SPONV) ( Flavivirus) is closely related to ZIKV and is the agent of Spondweni fever in people in Africa, which is readily confused with Zika [ 103]. It has been isolated from several species of mosquito, most significantly from the African forest-dwelling Aedes circumluteolus [ 94], but the vertebrate host is unknown. Although previously not thought to exist outside of Africa, SPONV was recently isolated from Culex spp. mosquitoes collected in Haiti in 2016 [ 103].
